org.drupal.project.computing

Class DSite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drupal.project.computing.DSite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DDrushSite, DServicesSite

    public abstract class DSite
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the super class to model a Drupal site. A Drupal Computing application will use a DSite class to connect to Drupal sites. The suggested way to pass data between applications and Drupal site is through the DRecord objects (maps to a Computing Entity). You would have your Drupal module write input data to a record, and then your application read it and write results back to the output field in the record, and your Drupal module can read data back to the database.

    Here we don't require DSite to offer nodeLoad(), nodeSave(), or userLoad(), which might be defined in DSiteExtended. If your application needs to read nodes, the Drupal part of your application will write the node info into the "input" field of computing_record, and then your Java application can read it. However, we don't prevent subclasses to provide a nodeLoad() method. If you use DDrushSite in particular, you can call any Drupal API with drush. Also, you can use DDatabase to access Drupal database directly, but it's not recommended.

    Some sub-class implementations: DServicesSite, DDrushSite

    • Method Detail

      • claimRecord

        public abstract DRecord claimRecord(java.lang.String appName)
                             throws DSiteException,
                                    DNotFoundException
        Get one available computing record from Drupal to process. Drupal will handle the logic of providing the record. If there's no record to return, throw DNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        appName - the Application name to claim a record.
        Returns:
        A computing record to handle, or NULL is none is found.
        Throws:
        DSiteException
        DNotFoundException

      • finishRecord

        public abstract void finishRecord(DRecord record)
                           throws DSiteException
        After agent finishes computation, return the results to Drupal.
        Parameters:
        record - the record to mark as finished and send back results.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • updateRecord

        public abstract void updateRecord(DRecord record)
                           throws DSiteException
        Save the updated record in the database.
        Parameters:
        record - The computing record to be saved.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • updateRecordField

        public abstract void updateRecordField(DRecord record,
                     java.lang.String fieldName)
                                throws DSiteException
        Update only the specified field of the record.
        Parameters:
        record - The computing record to be updated.
        fieldName - The field to be updated.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • createRecord

        public abstract long createRecord(DRecord record)
                           throws DSiteException
        Save the new record Drupal using the data in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        record - The newly created record. record.isSave() has too be true.
        Returns:
        The database record ID of the newly created record.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • loadRecord

        public abstract DRecord loadRecord(long id)
                            throws DSiteException
        Load one record according to its ID. This is expected to return a valid DRecord. If id is invalid, this function will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of computing record.
        Returns:
        the loaded DRecord.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • checkConnection

        public boolean checkConnection()
        Check whether connection to Drupal site is established.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is valid. will not throw exceptions.

      • getDrupalVersion

        public abstract java.lang.String getDrupalVersion()
                                           throws DSiteException
        Returns:
        The version of Drupal for this site.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • getTimestamp

        public abstract long getTimestamp()
                           throws DSiteException
        Returns:
        Drupal site's current timestamp. Equivalent to PHP time().
        Throws:
        DSiteException
